entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 5:07AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS DEVELOPING WITH SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... A series of strong storm systems moving into the Bering Sea will bring a prolonged period of strong east to southeast winds to much of Bristol Bay and the Kuskokwim Delta between Monday and Wednesday morning. Areas of light snow will spread northward with

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 1:49PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds And Blowing Snow Monday Through Wednesday... A series of storm systems moving into the southern Bering Sea will bring strong east winds along with blowing snow and reduced visibility to the West Coast through much of the early to middle part of next week. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 8:41AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SLICK ROAD CONDITIONS THIS MORNING... A mix of lake effect snow and patchy freezing drizzle has resulted in very slippery travel this morning over portions of north central and western Upper Michigan. Motorists should slow down and allow extra driving time to reach their destinations this morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 7:16AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: Areas of drizzle and freezing drizzle will occur in the interior of northern lower Michigan this morning, especially south of M-32. This includes Cadillac, Houghton Lake, Grayling, and Kalkaska. Freezing drizzle will result in very light icing on pavement and elevated surfaces, including windshields. Precipitation is expected to turn to light snow by midday.

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued December 31 at 6:40AM MST until December 31 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern and southwestern South Dakota. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Cheyenne River Reservation and the Pine Ridge Reservation.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 7:56AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF FOG THIS MORNING... Areas of fog have developed across deep South Texas. Some visibilities have decreased to less than a mile and occasionally as low as one-quarter mile. The fog will dissipate later this morning. Motorists should use low beam headlights, reduce speed, and leave

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued December 31 at 6:03AM PST until December 31 at 12:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...In Oregon, Lower Columbia Basin of Oregon. In Washington, Kittitas Valley and Lower Columbia Basin of Washington. * WHEN...Until noon PST today.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kittitas Valley; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued December 31 at 5:19AM PST until December 31 at 12:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less at times in dense fog. * WHERE...In Oregon, Greater Portland Metro Area. In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...Until noon PST today.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 8:59AM CST until December 31 at 12:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch, mainly over southern sections of Manitowoc County. Roads remain slippery, so motorists are urged to slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * WHERE...Manitowoc, Door, and Kewaunee Counties.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 8:59AM CST until December 31 at 12:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Light snow and patchy freezing drizzle. Little additional snow accumulations expected. Roads remain slippery, so motorists are urged to slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * WHERE...Calumet, Winnebago, Brown, and Outagamie Counties.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 5:52AM CST until December 31 at 12:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Ashland and Iron Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Bad River Reservation and the northwestern area of the Lac du Flambeau Band.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 2:50AM CST until December 31 at 12:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
